abstract: After the Justice Department balked at 3M’s $550 million acquisition of a unit of Avery Dennison, the companies said they would seek to appease antitrust concerns.
snippet: After the Justice Department balked at 3M’s $550 million acquisition of a unit of Avery Dennison, the companies said they would seek to appease antitrust concerns.
lead_paragraph: 3M‘s acquisition of an Avery Dennison unit was in limbo on Wednesday, as the companies scrambled to clear regulatory obstacles.

headline.main: 3M and Avery Dennison ‘Committed’ to Deal Despite Antitrust Issue
